title: Sample section template schema
description: Sample section template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.7.1

propertyDescriptions.source_storage_duration_value: The length of time the sample was stored prior to processing it. For assays performed on tissue sections, this refers to how long the tissue section (e.g., slide) was stored before the assay began (e.g., imaging). For assays performed on suspensions, such as sequencing, it refers to how long the suspension was stored before library construction started. Example: 12.
propertyDescriptions.processing_time_value: The duration for which the tissue was handled prior to its initial preservation. Example: 120.
propertyDescriptions.quality_criteria: The quality criteria used to assess the sample, which may include metrics such as RIN (e.g., RIN: 8.7) or visual inspection parameters for suspensions prior to cell lysis. These criteria can be captured at a high level with general terms like "OK" or "not OK" or with more specific descriptors such as "debris" "clump" or "low clump". Example: RIN: 8.7, low clump, no visible debris.
propertyDescriptions.histological_report: The key variables in the histopathological report that are crucial for assessing the tissue, including the absence of necrosis, comments on tissue composition, descriptions of significant pathology, and high-level assessments of inflammation or fibrosis. Example: No necrosis observed; tissue composed predominantly of hepatocytes with mild portal inflammation and minimal fibrosis.
propertyDescriptions.thickness_value: The thickness of an object in question. Example: 10.
propertyDescriptions.section_index_number: The index number assigned to the tissue section, with numbering beginning at 1 for sections within a block. Example: 1.
propertyDescriptions.area_value: The area of the object being measured. Example: 100.
propertyDescriptions.notes: Miscellaneous details about the sample that are not captured in the existing metadata fields. Example: Sample was stored at 4Â°C for 48 hours prior to processing due to equipment maintenance delay.
propertyDescriptions.source_storage_duration_unit: The unit of measurement used to specify the source storage duration value. Example: hour.
propertyDescriptions.preparation_medium: The medium used during the sample preparation process. If no specific medium was utilized, enter "None". If medium was not recorded, enter "Unknown". Example: Fresh frozen CMC.
propertyDescriptions.preparation_condition: The condition under which the sample preparation took place, such as whether the sample was placed on dry ice during the process. If preparation condition was not recorded, enter "Unknown". Example: Frozen on dry ice.
propertyDescriptions.processing_time_unit: The unit of measurement for the processing time value. If processing time is not specified, this field may be left blank. Example: minute.
propertyDescriptions.storage_medium: The medium used to preserve the sample. If no specific medium was utilized, enter "None". If medium was not recorded, enter "Unknown". Example: FFPE (Paraffin embedded).
propertyDescriptions.storage_method: The method used to store the sample after preparation and prior to performing the assay. If no specific storage method was utilized, enter "None". If storage method was not recorded, enter "Unknown". Example: Frozen in dry ice.
propertyDescriptions.thickness_unit: The unit of measurement for the thickness value. If no thickness measurement is specified, this field may be left blank. Example: mm.
propertyDescriptions.area_unit: The unit of measurement used to define the area. If no area value is specified, this field may be left blank. Example: mm^2.
propertyDescriptions.lab_id: A locally assigned identifier provided by the data provider for the dataset. It is used to reference an external metadata record that may be maintained independently, enabling traceability and supporting provenance tracking. Example: Visium_9OLC_A4_S1.
propertyDescriptions.preparation_protocol_doi: The DOI for the protocols.io page that details the assay or the procedures used for sample procurement and preparation. For example, in the case of an imaging assay, the protocol may start with tissue section staining and end with the generation of an OME-TIFF file. The documented protocol should also include any image processing steps involved in producing the final OME-TIFF. Example: https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.eq2lyno9qvx9/v1.
propertyDescriptions.sample_id: The unique identifier assigned to the sample. Example: HBM743.CKJW.876.
propertyDescriptions.is_rehydrated: Indicates whether the section was rehydrated. Example: No.

about.title: about field schema
about.description: about field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.7.1

_ui._content:
About this metadata template

This template provides metadata fields for sample section, in alignment with FAIR data principles to promote data sharing and reuse. Structured metadata enhances the discoverability, accessibility, interoperability, and reproducibility of biomedical research data.

Developed through community efforts within the HuBMAP and SenNet consortia, the template leverages the CEDAR Workbench platform for streamlined metadata authoring and management. These efforts contribute to enabling broad, consistent data sharing across the research community in accordance with NIH data sharing policies.

For assistance, please visit the HuBMAP Contact page or the SenNet Contact page.

Funding: This work was supported in part by IEC-HuBMAP (NIH Award OT2OD033759), IEC-SenNet (NIH Grant U24CA268108), Penn-DCWG (NIH Grant U54HD104392), and Stanford-CEDAR (NIH Grant U54AI117925).

Citation: Use the following reference to cite the metadata specification: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41556-023-01194-w.

about.schema:name: about

Funding: IEC-HuBMAP (NIH Award OT2OD033759), IEC-SenNet (NIH Grant U24CA268108), Penn-DCWG (NIH Grant U54HD104392), Stanford-CEDAR (NIH Grant U54AI117925).
